xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager

Interface Strategy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Convertable, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStrategy, AppendOnlyNStrategy, AppendOnlyStrategy, BestFitOnNEmptiestPagesStrategy, BestFitStrategy, DecoratorTesterStrategy, FirstFitStrategy, HybridAONFStrategy, HybridBFOEStrategy, HybridStrategy, LastToFirstFitStrategy, LRUStrategy, NextFitStrategy, NextFitWithHStrategy, NextFitWithHWStrategy, OneRecordPerPageStrategy

    public interface Strategy
extends Convertable
    An interface for the strategies used by the Recordmanager. A strategy gets all calls to get, insert, update and remove methods from a record manager. This is so, because the strategy has to be informed about changes (for example to update histograms). So, the strategie usually gets a Container object inside the constructor.

    A Strategy is not allowed to access the paged directly, because the content of the Pages may be incomplete. The RecordManager stores some information inside its internal state.

    Every Strategy has to be convertable (serialize/deserialize the state of the Strategy).

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Closes the strategy.

      • Methods inherited from interface xxl.core.io.Convertable

        read, write

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(SortedMap pages,
          int pageSize,
          int maxObjectSize)
        Initializes the strategy. This call must be made, before the first real (other) operation is performed. The call can also be made multiple times. The PageInformation objects inside will not be changed until a page is removed (and realocated). So, a test with == is possible. But: to compare a pageId, the equals method must be used, because these identifyers must be regenerated when reread from seondary memory.
        Parameters:
        pages - SortedMap with key pageId and value of type PageInformation.
        pageSize - size of each page in bytes.
        maxObjectSize - Size of the largest record which can be stored inside the RecordManager.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the strategy. After closing, the state of the strategy still has to be convertable.

      • getPageForRecord

        Object getPageForRecord(int bytesRequired)
        Finds a block with enough free space to hold the given number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytesRequired - The free space needed, in bytes.
        Returns:
        Id of the Page or null, if no such page exists.

      • pageInserted

        void pageInserted(Object pageId,
                  RecordManager.PageInformation pi)
        Informs the strategy, that a new page has been inserted by the RecordManager.
        Parameters:
        pageId - identifyer of the page which has been inserted.
        pi - PageInformation for the page.

      • pageRemoved

        void pageRemoved(Object pageId,
                 RecordManager.PageInformation pi)
        Informs the strategy, that a page has been deleted by the RecordManager.
        Parameters:
        pageId - identifyer of the page which has been removed.
        pi - PageInformation for the page.

      • recordUpdated

        void recordUpdated(Object pageId,
                   RecordManager.PageInformation pi,
                   short recordNumber,
                   int recordsAdded,
                   int bytesAdded,
                   int linkRecordsAdded)
        Informs the strategy, that the RecordManager has performed an update on a certain page. size==-1 means removal.
        Parameters:
        pageId - identifyer of the page where an update has occured.
        pi - PageInformation for the page.
        recordNumber - number of the record which has been changed.
        recordsAdded - number of records which were added.
        bytesAdded - number of added bytes inside the Page (can be negative).
        linkRecordsAdded - number of link records added.
